title: Sydney protest ban extended after Bondi attack | 7NEWS
description: Sydney police have extended a ban on large protests across the metropolitan area for an additional two weeks, citing ongoing safety concerns following the Bondi attack. The Commissioner notes heightened community tension during the funeral period for Bondi victims, though smaller gatherings remain permitted if they don't spill onto city streets. The decision will be reviewed before potential Invasion Day protests scheduled for 26 January. title: PM announces $38m flood relief for Queensland | 7NEWS
description: The Prime Minister visits flood-affected western Queensland to announce a $38 million emergency rescue package jointly funded by federal and state governments. The support includes repairs to Cloncurry Airport, fodder drops for stranded livestock, and $21 million in disaster grants for farmers. A potential cyclone threatens far north Queensland with a 25 to 35 per cent chance of forming by Friday or Saturday, while another low-pressure system in the Gulf is being monitored for additional rainfall. title: East coast to swelter as heatwave rolls in
description: Authorities have issued warnings for Australia's east coast as multiple 40-degree days are forecast. #heatwave #weather #weatherwarning #wildweather #australia #heat

title: Police extend Sydney protest ban after Bondi
description: NSW Police have extended the ban on large protests across metropolitan Sydney for a further two weeks in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. #protest #ban #bondi #police #nswpolice

title: UK braces for storm as snow disrupts travel
description: The UK has been blanketed in a thick layer of snow, forcing hundreds of school closures and road, air and railway disruptions as Scotland, England and Northern Ireland brace for Storm Goretti. #storm #snow #goretti #uk #wildweather

title: Orthodox Christians celebrate feast day with cold plunge in Istanbul
description: Orthodox Christians in Istanbul have taken a winter plunge into the freezing waters of Golden Horn to celebrate feast of Epiphany. #celebration #coldplunge #winter #swim #istanbul

title: Ukraine allies sign security guarantees ahead of peace deal
description: Leaders from Ukraine's key allies gathered in Paris for a Coalition of the Willing meeting, where they signed security guarantees including the deployment of a multinational military force in anticipation of a peace deal with Russia. US Special Envoy Steve Witkoff affirmed Donald Trump's desire for peace in Ukraine, with leaders describing the meeting as a significant step forward in building practical foundations for peace. #ukraine #europe #eu #security #zelensky

title: Elon Musk on track to become first trillionaire | 7NEWS
description: Elon Musk is on track to become the world's first trillionaire, with his wealth rapidly growing through Tesla and SpaceX, the latter expected to IPO at a valuation potentially reaching $1.5 trillion USD. Musk has reconciled with President Trump after a public falling out, regaining significant political influence and access to government. A Tesla pay package approved by shareholders could unlock another trillion dollars if Musk successfully transforms the company from an automaker into a robotics manufacturer. title: Thousands of cattle lost in Queensland floods | 7NEWS
description: Severe flooding along the Diamantina River has devastated cattle stations across Queensland's Winton, Cloncurry, Julia Creek and McKinlay Shires, with thousands of head of cattle lost. Helicopter pilots are conducting emergency fodder drops to stranded livestock mobs while producers remain isolated in their homes, unable to access properties except by air. The full extent of livestock losses won't be known until floodwaters recede over the coming weeks. title: 'Absolutely critical': Extreme heat warning issued for Sydney | 7NEWS
description: Extreme heat conditions are forecast for Sydney and Western Sydney, with temperatures expected to reach close to 44 degrees Celsius over the coming days. New South Wales health services and emergency personnel are preparing for increased demand, with additional resources being deployed to handle heat-related incidents. Critical safety measures include exercising only during cooler hours, staying hydrated throughout the day, checking on elderly family members and young children, and never leaving children unattended in vehicles. title: Robotic puppy offers hope for dementia patients | 7NEWS
description: TomBot is a highly realistic robotic puppy designed to provide companionship for seniors with dementia and mild cognitive impairment. The lifelike robotic pet was developed after the founder's mother with Alzheimer's rejected traditional substitutes when her real dog had to be removed for safety reasons. Research shows robotic animals significantly outperform stuffed animals and dolls in reducing loneliness, anxiety, depression, and pain in dementia patients, with over 300 million seniors worldwide potentially benefiting from this technology. title: International car theft syndicate dismantled in Brisbane | 7NEWS
description: An international car theft syndicate stole 20 Toyota vehicles, including Land Cruisers and Prados, across Greater Brisbane between October and December last year. Queensland Police dismantled the operation, recovering 15 vehicles from locations including a Rocklea wrecking yard and ports in Brisbane and Melbourne, with seven men charged with over 380 offences. The sophisticated syndicate, involving foreign nationals from Brazil, Fiji, Japan and Afghanistan, was shipping stolen vehicles in containers to the United Arab Emirates for resale. title: Lego launches first smart brick at Las Vegas electronics show
description: Lego has entered the digital age with the launch of its first smart brick at an electronics show. #lego #smartbrick #tech #toys #starwars

title: New bodycam shows chaos after Louisville cargo plane crash | 7NEWS
description: Police have released new bodycam vision of the moments after a cargo aircraft crashed after takeoff from Louisville, Kentucky in November, killing 15 people including three crew members. The plane, Flight 2976 bound for Honolulu, Hawaii, caught fire shortly after leaving the ground and carved a destructive path through an industrial area, with flames spreading over a kilometre. The fully-fuelled McDonnell Douglas three-engine jet struck a petroleum recycling facility and auto parts store, causing a massive fire fuelled by over 250,000 gallons of jet fuel. title: Teenager critical after stabbing at house party in Shalvey, Sydney
description: A 17-year-old boy is in a critical condition after being stabbed at a house party at Shalvey in Sydney's west. #shalvey #sydney #westernsydney #sydneycrime #nswpolice
